page.title: 11Holwell Historic Houses
page.content:
WESTROW HOUSE dates from 1750. Restored over the years and stands in park-like surroundings. A family home. LITTLE WESTROW. Late Elizabethan with some original beams, Tudor fireplaces, inglenook and bee-bole. WESTROW COTTAGES (2). 1704, modernised and now one dwelling. HOLWELL MANOR. Oldest part 13th century, once King John's hunting- lodge, now much restored and a grace- ful family home.
Pulham Historic Houses
RECTORY. 1725. Gothic facade 1780. Wing added 1840. Round drawing-room a feature. Family home. CHURCH. Records from 11th century. Present building 1419. Norman door with priest's chamber above.
